meanings.definition: A feeling of disgust or aversion.
meanings.sent1: The sight of the slimy bug gave me the yucks.
meanings.sent2: She wrinkled her nose in yucks at the smell of the spoiled milk.
meanings.sent3: The yucks on his face were priceless when he tasted the bitter medicine.
meanings.sent4: The thought of eating snails gave her the yucks like nothing else.
meanings.sent5: The yucks overwhelmed her when she stepped on a squishy slug.

meanings.definition: An expression of distaste or revulsion.
meanings.sent1: His loud yucks made it clear he didn't like the new food.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help but let out a yucks when she saw the creepy crawly bug.
meanings.sent3: The yucks on his face were exaggerated but hilarious.
meanings.sent4: Her yucks echoed through the room, expressing her disgust.
meanings.sent5: The yucks on his face were so vivid, everyone knew he hated the surprise gift.

meanings.definition: Something that is unpleasant or unappealing.
meanings.sent1: The mushy peas were a real yucks for him.
meanings.sent2: The movie was full of yucks, making it hard to watch.
meanings.sent3: The yucks of the situation made everyone laugh despite the mess.
meanings.sent4: The yucks of the old, moldy bread was a stark reminder of neglect.
meanings.sent5: The yucks of the slimy texture stayed with her long after she washed her hands.
